task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 284°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the main building (base to roof), so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.

The view is now facing north instead of toward the target building at ~284° west-northwest, so I should rotate left to re-align with the building while keeping the upward pitch to capture its roofline.
I’m aligned to the target building at ~284° but need to see the roof to estimate total height, so I should tilt up.
The heading has reset to 0° again, so I must rotate left to roughly 284° while keeping the upward pitch to view the building’s top.
To estimate height I need a view including the roofline, so I should look up while staying aimed at 284°.
I need to stop the repeated heading reset by directly rotating to the target azimuth (~284°) from 0° while keeping pitch up.
Since rotating up seems to reset the heading, I should stay at pitch 0 and instead move closer to better judge the building’s number of floors and approximate height.
After moving, I’m facing north; I need to rotate left to re-align with the target building at ~284°.
Now that I’m closer and correctly oriented, I should look slightly up to include the roofline for a height estimate.
The heading reset again, so I must rotate back to ~284° (76° left from north) while keeping the current pitch.
Since pitch changes are breaking the heading context, I should estimate using visible floors at pitch 0 and stop with an approximate total height.
